alert.note: Alert for Giles (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 29 at 3:56PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following county, Giles. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 356 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Kimberling Creek, Little Stony Creek, Walker Creek, Little Walker Creek, Wabash Creek, Broad Hollow Creek, Sugar Run, Cecil Branch, New River, Dry Branch and Stony Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pearisburg, Poplar Hill, Bane, White Gate and Kimballton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
